The Lamborghini Countach is a iconic car, and building a 1/24 scale model of it can be a challenging but rewarding project. Aligning the body panels can be a frustrating task, especially with intricate parts. It's great that you're recognizing your limits and taking a break to recharge. Sometimes, stepping away from a project can help you clear your mind and come back to it with a fresh perspective.

It's awesome that you have other projects lined up, though! The P-51 Mustang is a beautiful aircraft, and the 1/48 scale is a great size for capturing the details. The USS Nimitz aircraft carrier is a massive project, but it'll be an impressive addition to your collection once it's complete. Working on different projects can help you develop new skills and techniques, and it's always exciting to explore new subjects and scales.

When you do return to the Lamborghini Countach, you might consider using some alignment tools or techniques to help you get the body panels in place. There are various methods and products available, such as alignment pins, clamps, or even 3D-printed alignment tools. You can also try using a combination of glue and tape to hold the parts in place while the glue sets.

In the meantime, which of the two new projects are you most excited to start on? The P-51 Mustang or the USS Nimitz?
